data.title: Assembly & Packaging Equipment
data.meta_description: Assembly and packaging equipment refers to the machinery and tools used in the process of packaging and assembling integrated circuits (ICs) and other microelectronic devices. This includes equipment used for die bonding, wire bonding, encapsulation, molding, and testing of packaged devices. Some common types of assembly and packaging equipment include die bonders, wire bonders, molding machines, and test handlers. The selection of assembly and packaging equipment depends on factors such as the size and complexity of the device, the required production volume, and the desired level of automation. There are several large manufacturers of assembly and packaging equipment, including: ASM Assembly Systems Kulicke & Soffa Industries Disco Corporation SUSS MicroTec EV Group Temescal Systems Palomar Technologies SunEdison Semiconductor Limited NEXX Systems Inc. Rudolph Technologies. These companies have a strong presence in the semiconductor industry and offer a wide range of assembly and packaging equipment solutions. However, the largest manufacturer in this field might vary depending on the region and market demand.
